intro: Senecio renjifoanus, commonly known as the Renjifo's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing adaptations to cold and arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and sometimes covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
